ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.controllers

Class ChoiceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.controllers.ChoiceController

  • public class ChoiceController
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: Responsible for manipulating the current choice model. It keeps a reference to the current choice model as a field and updates that whenever the user makes changes. This controller however does not push changes to the database. Since a choice is part of a chapter, then it will get added on to the chapter it belongs to, and when the chapter's changes are pushed to the database, the choices it contains are are also saved /updated in the database.

    Design Pattern: This class is a singleton, so only one instance of it will ever exist. use getInstance() to retrieve that instance, not the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ChoiceController getInstance(Context context)
        Returns an instance of a ChoiceController. The same instance is always returned since it is a singleton. This is the method every other class should be using to access the ChoiceController. Note that this method must be called statically.

        Example call:
        ChoiceController control = ChoiceController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        Parameters:
        context - Could be an activity or application context.

      • setCurrChoice

        public void setCurrChoice(Choice aChoice)
        Sets the current choice model as the choice field of the class. Now any modifications needed to be done by the user will be done using methods in this class that update the choice field.

        Example Call:
        Choice myChoice = new Choice(UUID.randomUUID(), "choice text");
        ChoiceController choiceCon = ChoiceController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        choiceCon.setCurrChoice(myChoice);
        Parameters:
        aChoice -

      • getCurrChoice

        public Choice getCurrChoice()
        Returns the current choice model (whichever choice is the choice field).

        Example Call:
        ChoiceController choiceCon = ChoiceController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        Choice myChoice = choiceCon.getCurrChoice();

      • editText

        public void editText(java.lang.String text)
        Edits the choice model's text. No view is allowed to do this directly, so they use this method.

        Example Call:
        Choice myChoice = new Choice(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChoiceController control = ChoiceController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChoice(myChoice);

        String text = "new text";
        control.editText(text);
        Parameters:
        text - String that you would like to set as the choice's text.

      • editChapterTo

        public void editChapterTo(java.util.UUID id)
        Edits the choice model's next chapter id (the id of the chapter that the choice will link to when selected). No view is allowed to do this directly, so they use this method.

        Example Call:
        Choice myChoice = new Choice(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChoiceController control = ChoiceController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChoice(myChoice);

        control.editChapterTo(UUID.randomUUID());
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the chapter you now want the choice to link to. Must be a UUID.
